title: Revelation Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Revelation with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 22 chapters.

questions.question: Who is described as the 'Alpha and Omega' in Revelation?
questions.explanation: Jesus Christ is called the Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end, in Revelation 1:8 and 22:13.

questions.question: To which island was John exiled when he received the Revelation?
questions.explanation: John was on the island called Patmos because of the word of God and the testimony of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What is the number of the churches to whom John was instructed to write?
questions.explanation: John was instructed to write to the seven churches in Asia: Ephesus, Smyrna, Pergamos, Thyatira, Sardis, Philadelphia, and Laodicea.

questions.question: What does the mystery of the seven stars and seven golden candlesticks represent?
options: The angels of the seven churches and the seven churches themselves
The seven seals and seven trumpets
The seven spirits before Godâ€™s throne and the seven lampstands
The seven mountains and seven kings
questions.correctAnswer: The angels of the seven churches and the seven churches themselves
questions.explanation: The seven stars are the angels of the seven churches, and the seven candlesticks are the seven churches.

questions.question: What color was the horse of the rider who went forth conquering and to conquer?
questions.explanation: The rider on the white horse had a bow and a crown and went forth conquering and to conquer.

questions.question: What power was given to the rider on the red horse?
options: To take peace from the earth and make men kill one another
questions.correctAnswer: To take peace from the earth and make men kill one another
questions.explanation: The red horse's rider was given power to take peace from the earth and to make men kill one another.

questions.question: What was the name of the pale horse's rider?
questions.explanation: The pale horse's rider was named Death, and Hell followed with him.

questions.question: How long will the two witnesses prophesy while clothed in sackcloth?
options: One thousand two hundred and threescore days
questions.correctAnswer: One thousand two hundred and threescore days
questions.explanation: The two witnesses will prophesy for 1,260 days clothed in sackcloth.

questions.question: What miracles do the two witnesses have power to perform?
options: Shut heaven so it doesn't rain, turn waters to blood, and smite the earth with plagues
Raise the dead and heal the sick
Part the sea and bring fire from heaven
questions.correctAnswer: Shut heaven so it doesn't rain, turn waters to blood, and smite the earth with plagues
questions.explanation: The two witnesses have power to shut heaven, turn waters to blood, and smite the earth with plagues.

questions.question: Where will the dead bodies of the two witnesses lie after they are killed?
options: In the street of the great city called Sodom and Egypt
In a tomb on Mount Zion
questions.correctAnswer: In the street of the great city called Sodom and Egypt
questions.explanation: Their dead bodies will lie in the street of the great city, spiritually called Sodom and Egypt.

questions.question: What happens after three and a half days to the two witnesses?
options: The Spirit of life from God enters them and they stand on their feet
They are resurrected and ascend to heaven immediately
They are buried by their followers
They are forgotten by the people
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit of life from God enters them and they stand on their feet
questions.explanation: After three and a half days, the Spirit of life from God enters them and they stand upon their feet.

questions.question: What is the name of the place where the kings of the earth are gathered for battle?
questions.explanation: The kings of the earth are gathered to a place called Armageddon for the great battle.

questions.question: What did the first angel pour out his vial upon?
questions.explanation: The first angel poured out his vial upon the earth causing sores on those with the mark of the beast.

questions.question: What was the effect of the second angel's vial poured upon the sea?
options: It became as the blood of a dead man, and every living soul died in the sea
The sea was filled with frogs
questions.correctAnswer: It became as the blood of a dead man, and every living soul died in the sea
questions.explanation: The sea turned to blood like that of a dead man and every living thing in it died.

questions.question: Which river was dried up by the sixth angel pouring out his vial?
questions.explanation: The sixth angel poured out his vial upon the great river Euphrates, causing it to dry up.

questions.question: What came out of the mouths of the dragon, the beast, and the false prophet?
questions.explanation: Three unclean spirits like frogs came out of their mouths to gather the kings to the battle.

questions.question: What is the blessing pronounced on the one who reads and hears the words of the prophecy and keeps those things written therein?
options: Blessed is he that readeth, and they that hear the words of this prophecy, and keep those things
Blessed is the one who gives alms
Blessed are the pure in heart
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed is he that readeth, and they that hear the words of this prophecy, and keep those things
questions.explanation: Revelation 1:3 pronounces a blessing on those who read, hear, and keep the prophecy's words.

questions.question: Which church is described as neither cold nor hot, but lukewarm?
questions.explanation: The church of Laodicea is described as lukewarm, neither cold nor hot.

questions.question: True or False: The seven seals opened by the Lamb reveal the coming judgments and events.
questions.explanation: The opening of the seven seals reveals key judgments and events in the book of Revelation.

questions.question: True or False: The temple of God is opened in heaven to reveal the ark of his testament after the seventh trumpet sounds.
questions.explanation: After the seventh trumpet, the temple of God in heaven is opened and the ark is seen.

questions.question: True or False: The great city Babylon is destroyed by fire at the pouring out of the first vial.
questions.explanation: Babylon's destruction is described later, not at the first vial but at the seventh vial and other judgments.

questions.question: True or False: The four living creatures each have six wings and are full of eyes around and within.
questions.explanation: The four living creatures are described as having six wings and full of eyes within and without.

questions.question: True or False: The number of the beast is 666.
questions.explanation: The number of the beast is explicitly given as 666 in Revelation 13:18.

questions.question: True or False: The New Jerusalem comes down from heaven prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.
questions.explanation: The holy city, New Jerusalem, is described as coming down from heaven ready like a bride.

questions.question: True or False: In Revelation, the tree of life is found in the streets of the New Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: The tree of life grows by the river of the water of life, not in the streets.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Behold, I come quickly: blessed is he that ______, and keepeth his garments, lest he walk naked, and they see his shame.'
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes being watchful and keeping garments to avoid shame.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And he laid his right hand upon me, saying unto me, Fear not; I am the first and the ______.'
questions.explanation: Jesus reassures John by saying He is the first and the last.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And the leaves of the tree were for the ______ of the nations.'
questions.explanation: The leaves of the tree of life are for the healing of the nations.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And he had in his right hand seven stars: and out of his mouth went a sharp ______ sword.'
questions.explanation: The sharp two-edged sword symbolizes the word of Christ.

questions.question: What is the role of the seven angels with the seven trumpets in Revelation?
options: To sound the trumpets which bring judgments upon the earth
To bind Satan for a thousand years
To pour out the vials of wrath
questions.correctAnswer: To sound the trumpets which bring judgments upon the earth
questions.explanation: Seven angels sound the seven trumpets, each heralding a judgment.

questions.question: Which chapter describes the 'marriage of the Lamb' and the New Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: The marriage of the Lamb is in chapter 19, and New Jerusalem is described in chapter 21.

questions.question: What does the 'beast from the sea' symbolize according to Revelation?
options: A political power or kingdom opposed to God
questions.correctAnswer: A political power or kingdom opposed to God
questions.explanation: The beast from the sea represents a kingdom or political power opposing God.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 144,000 sealed servants in Revelation?
options: They are servants of God sealed for protection during judgment
They are kings of the earth
questions.correctAnswer: They are servants of God sealed for protection during judgment
questions.explanation: The 144,000 are sealed servants of God to be protected during the tribulation.

questions.question: Which symbol in Revelation represents the Holy Spirit?
questions.explanation: The seven Spirits before God's throne symbolize the fullness of the Holy Spirit.

questions.question: True or False: The Lamb that was slain is worthy to open the book with seven seals.
questions.explanation: Only the Lamb, who was slain, is worthy to open the sealed book.

questions.question: True or False: The New Jerusalem has twelve gates, each gate named after one of the twelve tribes of Israel.
questions.explanation: The city has twelve gates named after the twelve tribes.

questions.question: True or False: The river of the water of life flows from the throne of God and the Lamb in the New Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: This river flows from God's throne bringing life eternal.

questions.question: True or False: The 'mark of the beast' is required to buy or sell in the end times.
questions.explanation: Those without the mark cannot buy or sell according to Revelation 13:17.

questions.question: True or False: The angel said, 'Seal not the sayings of the prophecy of this book,' because the time is near.
questions.explanation: The prophecy is to be revealed because the time is near.

questions.question: Who is the 'faithful witness, and the first begotten of the dead, and the prince of the kings of the earth'?
questions.explanation: Jesus is described as the faithful witness and first begotten of the dead.

questions.question: What is said to follow the rider named Death on the pale horse?
questions.explanation: Hell followed the pale horse's rider, Death.

questions.question: What is the reaction of the kings and people of the earth at the opening of the sixth seal?
options: They hide in the mountains and ask the rocks to fall on them
questions.correctAnswer: They hide in the mountains and ask the rocks to fall on them
questions.explanation: They seek to hide from the wrath of the Lamb during the great day of his wrath.

questions.question: What is the meaning of 'the seven Spirits which are before his throne'?
options: They represent the fullness of the Holy Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: They represent the fullness of the Holy Spirit
questions.explanation: The seven Spirits symbolize the complete and perfect Holy Spirit.

questions.question: How does the book of Revelation describe the voice of Jesus Christ?
options: As the sound of many waters
questions.correctAnswer: As the sound of many waters
questions.explanation: His voice is described as the sound of many waters, indicating power and majesty.

questions.question: What is the 'new name' given to the one who overcomes, as mentioned in Revelation 2-3 letters to the churches?
options: The name of God, the New Jerusalem, or Christ's name
questions.correctAnswer: The name of God, the New Jerusalem, or Christ's name
questions.explanation: Overcomers receive a new name, the name of God, the New Jerusalem, or Christ's name.
